Name: CUF 1a. Direct casualty: return fire, move to cover
CUF 1b. Direct casualty to apply self aid if possible
CUF 2a. Move past the casualty with security and return fire
CUF 2b. Evaluator will state "Enemy fire is suppressed"
CUF 3a. Move to casualty. leave security in defensive position
CUF 3b. Conduct a visual blood sweep

CUF 3c. Casualties extracted from burning vehicles and moved to
relative safety.
CUF 3d. Do what is necessary to stop the burning process
START Tactical Field Care Phase (Primary Assessment)
PA 1b. Check for signs of life
PA 2. Observe for any amputations or obvious extremity bleed
A 3e. If unconscious w/o obstruction, open and assess
A 3f. Position casualty to maintain open airway
A 3g. Insert adjunct as indicated and secure
R 4b. If  injuries permit, position casualty to facilitate respiratory
C 8. Notify the Tactical Leader for evacuation
START Tac Leader notifies Medic of MEDEVAC ETA
H 9. Prepare casualty for transport to HLZ
H 11. Check for drug allergy b4 administration
H 13. Ask Tac Leader for MEDEVAC ETA
CA 16a. Inspect for DCAP-BTLS and palpate for TIC
CA 16b. Auscultate bilaterally for lung sounds
